Art. 4.142. 
Doctors and health care providers 
Health care professionals who have treated a person during the illness from which he or she dies may not benefit from any gifts which he or she may have made in their favour during the course of that illness.
 Managers and members of staff of residential care institutions for the elderly may not benefit from gifts made to them by a person accommodated in their institution during his or her stay.   
The following are excepted: 
1¡ gifts in lieu of payment made on a special basis, having regard to the capacity of the person making the gift and the services rendered; 
2¡ gifts in favour of relatives up to and including the fourth degree, provided that the deceased had no heirs in the direct line; unless the person in whose favour the gift was made is himself one of those heirs; 
3¡ gifts in favour of the spouse, legal cohabitant or person living in a marital relationship with the person making the gift.
The same rules apply to ministers of religion and other ecclesiastics, as well as to delegates of the Central Lay Council.
